com.camerontec.catalys.server.ha.collections.synchronization

Class SynchronizationController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.server.ha.collections.synchronization.SynchronizationController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IEventListener<GroupEvent>, IDistributedCollectionRegistrySynchronizationListener, IDistributedCollectionSynchronizationListener, ISynchronizationController, ICollectionLifecycleListener

    public class SynchronizationController
extends Object
implements ISynchronizationController, IEventListener<GroupEvent>, ICollectionLifecycleListener, IDistributedCollectionSynchronizationListener, IDistributedCollectionRegistrySynchronizationListener
    Synchronization controller implementation.
    The synchronization controller has dependencies on:
    • An IDistributedGroupController providing access to group snapshots and group change events.
    • The IClusterDefinition exposing the identities of the nodes in the cluster.
    • An ISynchronizationFailureListener for reporting unexpected failures.
    • The distributed collection registry, fetched from the application's runtime registry.
    The synchronization controller implements a state machine running off its own thread. The state machine uses the following sequence of states: Stopped, Synchronizing the registry contents, Synchronizing the registry elements, Synchronized. The state machine processes a number of events at the same time as it tries to reach its Synchronized state. The following table summarizes the state transition logic as well as the way events are handled:

    (1) Stopped (2) Synchronizing the registry contents (3) Synchronizing the registry elements (4) Synchronized
    Actions -
    1. Keep trying to synchronize the contents of the registry.
    2. Upon success, add all distributed collections to the queue of unsynchronized items and transition to state (3).
    1. Take unsynchronized items from the queue one by one and try to synchronize them.
    2. Upon failure, put the current unsynchronized item back into the queue.
    3. Once the queue of unsynchronized items is empty, transition to state (4).
    		 Wait for something to happen.
    Start Transition to state (2) - - -
    Stop - Transition to Stopped Transition to Stopped Transition to Stopped
    New cluster node detected - Start again Start over from state (2) Start over from state (2)
    New distributed collection - Ignore, will be dealt with in state (3) Add to the queue of unsynchronized items
    • Add to the queue of unsynchronized items.
    • Start over from state (3)
    Distributed collection deleted - Ignore, will be dealt with in state (3) Remove from the queue of unsynchronized items if needed Ignore, we are still synchronized
    Distributed collection registry lost sync - Error, cannot happen Start over from state (2) Start over from state (2)
    Distributed collection lost sync - Ignore, will be dealt with in state (3) Add to the queue of unsynchronized items if needed
    • Add to the queue of unsynchronized items.
    • Start over from state (3)
    Instructed to synchronize - Start again Start over from state (2) Start over from state (2)

    • Constructor Detail

      • SynchronizationController

        public SynchronizationController(IDistributedGroupController groupController,
                                 IClusterDefinition clusterDefinition,
                                 ISynchronizationFailureListener failureListener,
                                 SynchronizationAttemptIntervalCalculator synchronizationAttemptIntervalCalculator)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        groupController - the IDistributedGroupController providing access to group snapshots and group change events
        clusterDefinition - the IClusterDefinition providing access to the identities of the nodes in the cluster
        failureListener - an ISynchronizationFailureListener for reporting unexpected failures
        synchronizationAttemptIntervalCalculator - the synchronization attempt interval calculator. If not null the passive site replication is on, otherwise the passive site replication is false.

      • synchronize

        public void synchronize()
                 throws IllegalStateException
        Description copied from interface: ISynchronizationController
        Forces a synchronization to happen. If a synchronization is currently in progress, causes it to start over. If the local node is currently in the synchronized state, causes a new synchronization attempt to start.
        Specified by:
        synchronize in interface ISynchronizationController
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the synchronization controller is not started
